preface.para: The Neutral convocation affects energy and magic directly. It rarely has any physical effect, though is good for defending against other magics.
Neutral elementals are raw magic, random and wild. They appear as a whirling cloud of bright motes. They cannot pass through physical objects, but can slip through a gap of almost any size.

The elemental's perception of the world is one based on aura's. Objects without an aura cannot be truly perceived, except as a featureless flatness. Living creatures, especially sapiants, can be clearly seen, and recognised by their aura. The aura sense of a magic elemental is equal to 5 x rank, though they can always tell the elemental affinity of a creature, including Shek-Pvar.
A magical elemental may strike at the lifeforce of a target, causing fatigue and confusion.

spell.name: Abort
spell.description: Abort disrupts another spell while it is being cast. The target spell caster is touched, and if the spell being cast is of equal or lower rank than the Abort, then the spell may be aborted, assuming the target spellcaster fails an opposed will check. The abort must be cast before the target spell is finished.

spell.name: Chain
spell.description: Chain links together multiple other spells, deferring fatigue until after all the spells have been cast. No spell in the chain can be higher rank than the Chain itself, and at most, 1 spell per rank of Chain (not including Chain itself) can be chained together. All the spells to be cast are declared, together with their order, targets etc, and chain is cast. If successful, the other spells are each cast. Once the final spell is cast, fatigue for all spells (including the chain) is then gained. No spell in the chain can have a casting time longer than a round, and all must be cast within a round of each other.

spell.name: Detect
spell.description: Detects magic in items and enchantments. The caster will see the item glow with a soft light in the colour of the enchantment's convocation. If the detected magic is of equal or lower rank of the detect, then the rank of the magic is known, otherwise it is simply known that it is of higher rank.

spell.name: Dispel
spell.description: This spell dispels another spell of equal or lower rank. The spell to be removed must have been identified. Only spells of duration Concentration or Ward can be affected. If the spell is being concentrated on, then the owner of that spell must make a will check against the caster of Dispel.

spell.name: Raldyn's Bubble
spell.boost: +50 Caster can move, and the bubble will follow
+100 Bubble can be detached, fixing it at one point
spell.description: When the spell is cast, a sphere is created around the caster the prevents any enchantments of lower rank from entering. Permanent enchantments are suspended by the spell. The caster cannot cast spells of lower rank herself while this spell is up. Also, she cannot move. If she moves, the bubble collapses.

spell.name: Eye of Kemdal
spell.description: A spell permitting the caster to survey his environment for the nearest spatio-temporal discontinuity (such as a godstone, Barasai Point, interdimensional vortex or other interworld portal). If it is out of range, she will learn its direction. Otherwise, she'll learn its general nature and rough distance.

spell.name: Ear of Pvara
spell.boost: +10 Can touch a person to allow them to understand the target instead
spell.description: An enchantment that enables the caster to understand a single, specified person in the absence of a common language. It does not allow the target to understand the caster. The level of skill granted with the language is 3.

spell.name: Tongue of Pvara
spell.boost: +10 Can touch a person to allow them to speak
spell.description: A self enchantment that enables the caster to be understood by a single, specified person in the absence of a common language. It does not allow her to understand the target. The level of skill granted with the language is 3.

spell.name: Veil of Nashal
spell.description: A spell to protect the caster from enchantment by granting a +5 bonus to resist the effects of a spell. This can be either a bonus to will, soak or any other applicable defence. Multiple veils can be stacked, but each only affects one spell. The veil hinders the caster's own spells. Each veil gives a cumulative -10 penalty to all spell casting rolls.

spell.name: Open
spell.description: Opens a minor artifact ready for storing spells into it. The artifact must have had 'focus' cast on it previously. An opened artifact can have spells placed into it with the use of Store.

spell.name: Store
spell.description: Stores the next spell cast into a minor artifact which has been opened for enchantment. The spell to be stored must be cast on the following round, and must be of at most the rank of the Store. Only the basic spell is stored - any effects of options are ignored. The spell to be stored cannot have a casting time longer than a round.

spell.name: Close
spell.boost: +25 Artifact can be activated with gestures
+50 Artifact can be actived with mental command. This requires the artifact to be attuned to
spell.description: Closes an opened minor artifact. At this point the trigger event for the artifact is also declared. The basic spell allows command phrases to activate the artifact.

spell.name: Disrupt
spell.description: This spell disrupts all magic in the area. Spells which are currently up will fail if their rank is less than or equal to the disrupt, however the Shek-Pvar maintaining the spell gets a will check to resist. Major artifacts are unaffected, though if they are maintaining spell effects, then they need to make a will roll as well to keep them maintained. Minor artifacts can be destroyed with this spell. If the Close that was used is of a equal or lower rank, then all spells in the minor artifact are lost. If the Focus is of equal or lower rank, then the artifact is rendered non-magical (and hence any spells in it are lost, regardless of the Close).
